bug.author: joshclancy
bug.summary: wandbLogger log Image does not seem to work.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
in normal pytorch I would log an Image in wandb like this: wandb.log({"Reconstruction":[wandb.Image(recon, caption="recon")]}) in lightning documentation it says: self.logger.experiment.some_wandb_function() I have used this to successfully log other metrics, but if I do this with Images: self.logger.experiment.log({"val_input_image":[self.logger.experiment.Image(val_batch[0][0].cpu(), caption="val_input_image")]}) I get this error: in validation_step(self, val_batch, batch_idx) 44 print("val_batch", val_batch[0][0].shape) 45 # wandb.log({"pred_image":[wandb.Image(mask, caption="pred")], "epoch":outputDict["epochNum"]}) ---> 46 self.logger.experiment.log({"val_input_image":[self.logger.experiment.Image(val_batch[0][0].cpu(), caption="val_input_image")]}) 47 return {'val_loss': val_loss, "val_acc" : acc, "log" : val_logs} 48 AttributeError: 'Run' object has no attribute 'Image' Any ideas how to get around this??

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!
Do this: self.logger.experiment.log({"val_input_image":[wandb.Image(val_batch[0][0].cpu(), caption="val_input_image")]}) ^ this With a bit of luck, I have not introduced a typo.
